str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) gen: I obtain, (b) absol: I chance, happen; ordinary, everyday, it may chance, perhaps.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Succor (against foes), help, aid, assistance. From a compound of epi and a form of the base of korasion; assistance.
As far as, up to, until, during. Or achris akh'-rece; akin to akron; until or up to.
This; he, she, it.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (properly: To call (summon) to witness, and then absolutely) To testify, protest, asseverate; To conjure, solemnly charge.
Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).
And, even, also, namely.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
No one, none, nothing.
From ek; the exterior; figuratively aside from, besides.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
And, even, also, namely.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
